story:
Short Summary

As a farmer most of my life I have made things to help make jobs more efficient or easier. I always loved dirt track stock car races and wanted to drive a race car myself. At age 49 I bought a 76 Camaro and drove 4 races. I sometimes led a few heat race laps and then I'd spin out. I didn't have the resources to continue. It was the thrill of a life time. While thinking about races often I come up with the idea for RACECARCoolers made just like a racing car and customized for each driver. I have spent most of my time the past 3 years bringing this project to reality. I'm so excited to have the opportunity to bring a new and unique product to avid NASCAR fans. I'm glad you are considering being a partner to help get this project going. 400 tailgating fans were interviewed at Kansas Speedway.  I was blown away by the enthusiasm.  They said "That is so cool.  Where can I get one."  Your partnership will be the catalyst to provide a cooler for each of those 400 avid fans plus millions more like yourself.  Share my excitement and get on board.

What We Need & What You Get

This project is on the all or none funding.  It is too huge and important for the project to get started and run out of money and fail.  No one would be happy in that situation.  My detailed plan will require $3,000,000 to make this an overwhelming sucess.  I have funded many things thus far; patenting, design engineer, prototyping, most of my time and resoures for 3 years.  The project is READY NOW.  Your contributions will provide for tool and die making, design engineer drawing for that tooling, blow molding of the cooler body and lids, graphic artist and decaling, boxes for shipment, warehouse lease to finish assembly of hinges and customize with your desired graphics, and an office space with shipping facilities.  All of the above businesses are ready to do their portion of building a customized RACECARCooler.  When you all partner with me to fully fund the project then promotion via ESPN ads at NASCAR Sprint Cup races will let every avid NASCAR fan in the world know about "our" cooler.  That is correct you can claim it as our's because of your sharing my passion to fully fund our project. 

The Impact

Our blow molder is located in a smaller rural type community.  I have met with the city commission to share our project's possibilities. This community is very welcoming for this project to become reality. Everything is going to be 100% USA.  The detailed plans call for a steady hiring of 160 people in the first months of production. This project is not enormous as big corporations, but it will certainly benefit our country and thus each individual.  There are fans worldwide who will share the excitement and value of our project.

Other Ways You Can Help

LICENSING - How you can help

All RACECARCoolers  must be licensed and have the legal rights from NASCAR and race teams.  In order to demonstrate your excitement of a new and unique product  to NASCAR, please copy and paste the following list and email NASCAR and the race teams.  Let our voice be heard! 

 

 

bmeyer@nascar.com

kjoyal@nascar.com

jdowling@earnhardtganassi.com

skeller@earnhardtganassi.com

sasha.soares@penskeracing.com

shammonds@jgiracing.com

joe@dalejr.com

bbaldwin@tommybaldwinracing.com

jhannigan@rpr43.com

bbusby@shrracing.com

jmurphy@joegibbsracing.com

lrogers@germain.com

webmaster@michaelwaltrip.com

gperkins@roushfenway.com

info@woodbrothersracing.com

jwhite@rcrracing.com

bray@swanracingco.com

heidis@faslaneracing.com

rjohnson@frontrowmotorsports.com

info@phoenixracinginc.com

nw52jmr@gmail.com

scott.liebert@furniturerow.com

rick.carpenter@bkracing.com

mcrenshaw@joenemechek.com

jen.bkmotorsports@gmail.com

cmcgarry@lfr95.com

meghan@philparsonsracing1.com

info@hillmanracing.com

tbridges@jdavismotorsports.com

dsetzer@tristarmotorsportsnc.com

tmilici@sr2motorsports.com

kennywallacefanclub@hotmail.com

pr@turnerscottmotorsports.com

vknill@tamrab.com

rwmotorsports5@hotmail.com

nascaredgy@yahoo.com

jen@jenniferjocobb.com

 

Simply copy and paste these addresses into your email:

 

Subject:  RACECARCoolers Licensing Request

 

I am excited about RACECARCoolers.     Please issue licensing to RACECARCoolers for this outstanding product so I can have one.  Thank you.

 I am a most appreciative NASCAR fan.

Some of you just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

I ask you folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

I remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Jaclyn Reinholz: Co-founder of Spectator Mapps, a senior in college and sports (semi) enthusiast. "I always want to know more about the teams I'm watching but don't want to Google everyone."

Derek Payton: Co-founder of Spectator Mapps, a senior in college and major sports enthusiast. "I always get lost on my way to the bathroom and want to find the shortest concession lines."

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to raise enough money to fund proper research and development of the app. We do not want to launch it unless it is fully ready. Funds will go first to development and then to marketing. But we will give our listed perks to our sponsors as soon as we can.

However, if we do not reach our goal in time, all funds will be returned in full.

    The Impact

    We believe Spectator Mapps will provide fans and enthusiasts with the necessary tools and information they need to be the ultimate fan. With our easy to follow directions for almost every stadium, arena, and museum, all kinds of fans will be able to get to their desired destination with ease and spend more time with their team, hobby, or art work.

      Risks & Challenges

      As students, we are not able to fund this plan ourselves and will strongly depend on outside contributions. We also have limited knowledge of every stadium and museum and will need to put in  a lot of time and effort to gather all the necessary information, not to mention the funds needed to get around to all these places.

      But we do feel that with the desired money needed we will be able to make this happen.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Even if you cannot provide additional funds, we ask you to please spread the word!

        There's no stronger marketing tool than the word of a trusted friend.

story:
Story

In these times of crises, conflicts and in an hostile climat, some animals are still abused, in absolute agony. We’re talking of course of the santa's reindeers… An exhausting work forces them to speed up at more than 649.95 miles per second (3000 times the speed of sound). That made us realize we had to help them. It’s for all of these reasons that we created this project. We want to replace them once and pull the sleigh of Santa Claus in order to relieve them. To achieve our goals, what solution was better than use bikes ? Directly inspired by the film E.T., we want to ride to Lapland with the flagship of the French Biking industry, the VLille. God bless France.



Reliable, manageable and frighteningly powerful, the VLille will allow us to reach the top! Armed with our reindeer masks (we don’t want to disturb the animal in its natural habitat), we’ll ride during 3 months to meet the north of Finland, and find the home of Santa Claus. This project cannot succeed without you. To finance the trip, we intend to bring our old cameras and shoot the most improbable landscapes of Europe and Scandinavia, in order to transcribe the 2000 miles epic trip on a legendary blog.


Risks

There are two main risks:
- Never find the home of Santa Claus. Then we will risk dying frozen.
- Popping a tire VLille. In this case, we will have to run to finish the trip, because it's to difficult to change a VLille's Tire.


Trip

story:
Tear up robots with lightspeed attacks and agility. Stop time, and transform when you reach MAX power! Exceed the limits you're used to, and hone Neon's ability to an instinct. Feel the power, in this solo-dev'd passion project inspired by legends like Sonic the Hedgehog, Dragonball, Super Smash Bros, Celeste, Bayonetta and Megaman! 

 

Try it for yourself! Experience Central District, a full area containing 4 levels, 2 bosses, a tutorial and a training room! Over 350,000 people across multiple platforms have already played and enjoyed the demo and nearly 10,000 have wishlisted on Steam! 

 

Take to Neopolis, a gargantuan metropolis that serves as the hub for the world's robots, to stop its absorption of Resonance, the planet's life force. Neon, a super fighting robot who can harness Resonance energy, is set in motion by their creator's soul being split from his body. Neon hopes that shutting the city down, and confronting Prof. Franca and her powerful Divas across Neopolis, the planet will re-stabilize and Prof. Oganesson can be made whole again.

 

Advent NEON's got a large focus on simple to learn mechanics with a high skill ceiling, with lots of room for skill expression. Neon has a full platform fighter's moveset to achieve this. The experience should feel fun, whether you're new, a veteran, an ultra-optimal speedrunner, or someone just looking to wavedash! Some of these mechanics include:

  •  Directional & Aerial Attacks - similar to attacks from Smash Bros!
  •  8-Way Dashing - the kind of dash from Celeste, but even faster!
  •  Time Stop - dash into danger at the right time to freeze everything!
  •  Cancelling - Perform new attacks and actions before old ones finish!
  •  Nodes & Healing - Collect them to increase Resonance and restore HP!
  •  Resonance - A percentage gauge that increases your damage output. Reach 100% to achieve...

 

As a reward for skillful play, transform into MAX Neon and snowball to nearly game-breaking levels of power, with maximized damage and speed, to wreak havoc on all before you, as long as you don't get hit! 

 

My goal is to make Advent NEON fun and fluid in any player's hands. To this end, committing to accessibility, tight controls and a lit gamefeel has been key, featuring:

  •  Simple, remappable controls
  • Gamepad, keyboard, mouse support
  •  No lives or "game overs"
  • Tweakable visual effects 
  • A training room to practice in
  •  Becoming too angry to die if you're having a rough time!

 The full game plans to have at least:

  • 7 Districts ("worlds"), containing at least 28 levels
  • 2 bosses per District
  • Mini-bosses in majority of levels
  • More accessibility and practice options
  • Options for hardcore and skilled players
  • Flashy finishing move for Max Neon
  • Optional content to unlock with your collected Nodes
  • One alternate game mode 

Name's Larry Boyd (CryoGX), and I'm an artist from NC, responsible for everything you've seen, heard and felt so far (art, music, animations, programming, sound, etc). I've been interested in creating ever since childhood, and have always been making art and music. I'd decided to get a degree in Computer Science with a concentration in game development, to really research and understand everything I'd need for my goals. Now that I'm out, Advent NEON is my way of applying all of that research and skill at once, to make the exact kind of game I want to see, knowing I'm the one who can make it.

story:
We created ayn with the dream of being a consumer-oriented company with some of the best products in the world at the lowest prices possible. We grew tired of seeing the same companies release overpriced products day in and day out while failing to address popular demands. We believe that a great product is one that is tailored toward the needs of the customer. That is why we spend time listening to the voices of our consumers. This means our devices are packed with features and specs at prices you could only dream about. At the end of the day, a great product speaks for itself and we hope that you will help fund our vision for a consumer-oriented future in this market.

 

There are risks with any project, and we want to be upfront about the potential risks associated with this product. Currently, we have already dealt with the most significant challenges that could delay our shipment.

Due to the continuing impact of Covid 19 on shipping, there is the potential for slight delays of items in transit. We hope that by shipping with DHL, we will deliver all perks based on our timeline. Thank you.

story:
Get ready to game more with xScreen

 

The power and performance of the Xbox Series S can now be taken anywhere. xScreen perfectly complements the stunning aesthetic of the Xbox Series S to create a single cohesive unit.  xScreen transforms your Xbox Series S into a laptop form factor that can be easily transported and used anywhere there is a power outlet.    

As seen on  

 And many more...

 

 

The games we enjoy the most have always been on traditional full-power consoles with wired connections to a TV.  Unfortunately a TV isn't always readily available so as a result there are many situations where we have had to compromise: 

  • Having to compete for the TV with other family members.
  • Wanting something to do when travelling, camping/glamping and wet weather strikes.
  • Travelling for work with a console and spending more time trying to connect to a hotel TV than actually playing a game.
  • Having friends over or visiting friends for a gaming session required packing up TV's, cables and consoles then lugging it all to the destination. Once you get there, trying to find the space for 3-4 friends to setup can be difficult.

 

 

 

We developed xScreen so that we could keep gaming when the big screen at home is not available or when we are visiting friends, going on holiday or anywhere else we want to still play full-power console games away from a fixed screen.

We made the xScreen for ourselves and our families. We have had such a positive response, we thought you might like it too...

With the release of Microsoft’s Xbox Series S, we saw an opportunity to create a portable full-power console due to its small form factor. The xScreen has an integrated design that connects to the Xbox Series S with a removable folding screen and included speakers providing a laptop like experience on a console.  Unlike previous solutions, due to the small form factor, the xScreen + Xbox Series S can easily be transported in any standard backpack. 

The xScreen's unique patent pending attachment connects directly into the HDMI and USB ports on the Xbox Series S. The USB powers the xScreen while the HDMI provides the screen and audio signal. The only cable required is the original power cable that came with the Xbox Series S.

 

 

 

 

1. Attach the xScreen to the HDMI and USB ports.

Align the HDMI and USB ports with the Xbox Series S

 

2. Secure the side latches.

Thumb screw on each side of the xScreen, securing the xScreen to the Xbox Series S

 

3. Plug in the power cable.

The original Xbox power cable plugs in via the rectangle gap in the back of the xScreen, directly into the Xbox Series S

 

4. Game time!!

Game time in nearly no time at all!!

 

 

In this demo we show the xScreen attaching, plus how the official Seagate Expansion drive works with the xScreen for Xbox Series S.  Check out the demonstration and some Assassin’s Creed Valhalla gameplay at the same time!

 

 

 

 

We will have additional accessories that will be available in the checkout post Indiegogo.

  • xScreen Colored Latches. Do you want to stand out from the Crowd or not want to mix up your xScreen with friends? Pick a color and make a statement.

 

  • xScreen Stand Feet. To add some viewing height while playing using the xScreen - just clip on the two stand feet and turn the Xbox Series S into a screen stand for the xScreen!

 

  • xScreen EVA Case. This holds the xScreen,  Xbox Series S plus controller and power cable.

 

 

xScreen was in-house developed then prototyped with 3D printing.  Several prototype versions have been evaluated and discarded on the journey to the first working prototype.

Early CAD designs and the first 3D printed Prototype

In the early stages, the design had to be printed in two sections (see the split in the rear photo above) due to the size limitations of the 3D printer. UPspec Gaming has since invested in larger 3D printers to enable a rapid prototyping process.

Prototyping process with 3D printing.

Design changes have occured during evolution of the protoype. One example of these changes has been the attachment of the xScreen to the Xbox, which has changed from simple pressure latches to the thumb screw latches in use today.

Design has een finalised, below is the exploded view of the final design. 

 

The final production model will use plastic that matches the Xbox Series S for a seamless finish.  For the prototype it is not possible to perfectly color match when 3D printing which is why the xScreen white is slightly different for the prototype.

 

 

Our timeline shown below provides a realistic plan for the production and delivery of the xScreen to you.  However we aim to do better, with our ultimate stretch goal is to deliver your xScreen before the end of year.  Watch out for updates!

 

 

UPspec Gaming is an Australian based start-up focussed on designing and selling unique gaming accessories. The company is founded by two Kiwi brothers who have been gaming together for over 30 years! xScreen is the first product from UPspec Gaming, with several other products already in the pipeline. 

 

MorphoMFG is our partner for all things manufacturing. From plastic injected moulding to the assembly line and quality control, MorphoMFG are ensuring your xScreen is made to the highest of standards. 

 

 

 

All shipping costs will be charged via Pledge Management at the end of the campaign. With continued uncertainty around the world, shipping prices continue to fluctuate, and we believe that charging you shipping when we have a clearer idea of how much it costs will reduce the cost to you.

As an estimate, we expect to charge you $40AUD (Approx. $30USD/€25EUR/£21GBP) worldwide.  We may also provide an additional courier option for certain countries.

Please note that we can’t cover taxes when it arrives in your country - you may be subject to these charges and should check the rules applicable in your own country.

story:
Dive into the well-known Myths of Lovecraft in a whole new way with this immersive, first-person, Point & Click, Graphic Adventure. Awarded the "Most Innovative Game" award by PlayStation and the "Best Sound" award by Gamepolis.

Immerse yourself in a distressing psychological thriller in which you will have to solve a series of murders occurred around the end of 2019. But this will just be the beginning of your story... Gather clues, solve intricate puzzles and prepare to face cults and primordials in an adventure that will test your sanity as you try to save the world.

Find out who is behind all this madness through the intertwined stories of four characters and defeat whoever is responsable for it... Or lose your sanity and join your enemy. But be careful! The paths you choose and the decisions you make will lead to different outcomes, and not all of them will be pleasant.

Live the most immersive DESOLATIUM experience with the VR version (Oculus, HTC VIVE and PlayStation VR) or enjoy a more classic experience without virtual reality on desktop (PC / Mac).

HOW TO GET MY PHYSICAL COPY?

 

  1. Go to “Dilettante - Physical copy” Perk on the right of the page.
  2. Add below the add-on perks you want.
  3. Proceed to checkout.
  4. After the campaign, we will contact you asking what physical version (PC, PS4, PSVR , XBOX or SWITCH) you want.

Carter wakes up on a bed in a strange room. He can’t remember anything, not even his own name, but the guards guarding the door make him suspect something is not right. His first goal will be to escape from there and find out what is happening.

When Carter's friends discover that he has disappeared, they move heaven and earth to find him. They will have to overcome many obstacles in a race against the clock, since if they do not succeed before nighttime, the world as we know it could come to an end.

Delve into an absorbing horror-tinged suspenseful story, based on the Lovecraft mythos. Explore iconic places of the Region de Murcia, investigate and solve puzzles to discover who is behind all this madness. You will have to walk in the shoes of four characters with four different paths and destinations... But, be careful! The decisions you make can have unexpected consequences.

Four characters, four points of view, various murders and disappearances, and a story where everything converges. Get inside the head of these different characters to investigate all the clues and hints, each with their unique abilities and characteristics, but all with a common goal: to discover the truth. Will they be ready for what they may find? Will you be?

Carter Scott

30 years old.

Carter wakes up in a hospital bed. He doesn't remember anything, and a terrible headache prevents him from thinking clearly. On the other side of the door he can see an armed guard guarding his room. Why is he there? Who is he? The only thing he knows for sure is that he has to get out of there.​

James Oslac

37 years old. Private investigator.

James is a private detective. Taciturn and melancholic, but with a keen eye for detail. He does not leave any case unresolved, whatever happens, least of all this one. This time he has not been hired, it is something personal. One of his best friends has disappeared and he thinks he has a hint as to where he may be. He will use every means available to him to find his friend, although he may have to risk his own life, or something more important.

Christopher Black

27 years old. Journalist.

Christopher always wanted to be a journalist. Since he was little, he dreamed of discovering a great scandal and uncovering it on the cover of a large newspaper. He hasn’t found the exclusive  that will make him famous yet, but he's about to get there. Heist, kidnappings, ritual murders, the story that he is investigating has all the ingredients to grant him the recognition he deserves. What he doesn't know is that his investigation is much bigger and far more dangerous than he imagines.

Sophie Whalen

55 years old. History teacher.

History professor for over 30 years. She loves her work at the university and is involved in an ambitious research of an ancient cult and its repercussions on the main religions. She has a very quiet life, always locked in offices and libraries, buried in books or consulting old archives. But soon her whole existence will be turned upside down. What if all the myths she has read about were true? What if all those creatures and dark deities really did exist?

​

Ghouls

Humanoid beings with canine-looking features and a very pale complexion. Perhaps at some point they were human, but not anymore. They feed on human flesh, so, if found, it would be near cemeteries. They can be incredibly strong despite their scrawny and lanky appearance.

Deep ones

They could be mistaken by humans, at least in their earliest stages. But as they get closer to their “final form” they begin to resemble fish-like creatures, with bulging eyes and skin covered in scales. They live in areas near the coast where they can keep a constant contact with sea water.

Lizardmen

Nobody knows where they come from, but they have been around us for a long time. Their real appearance is that of a lizard with a human shape, but you will never see one like that. They live among us using their "abilities" to seem like humans. It is said that they possess a very vast knowledge and that they will help those who serve them well...

Desolatium is a new way to fully immerse yourself, in first person, in the Point & Click Graphic Adventure genre. It incorporates features of Survival Horror so that you can live a unique experience, such as real settings, the ambisonic sound (8D), a Lovecraftian narrative and hyper-realistic graphics, enriching your gaming experience.  

Full immersion

To get you fully immersed we have invested all our efforts into enhancing the sound and hyper-realistic graphics, combining them with a chilling story based on Lovecraft’s Myths, and with a decision-making system that will transport you straight into a story like you have never experienced before.

Live the most immersive DESOLATIUM experience with the VR version (OculusRift, HTC VIVE and PSVR) or enjoy a more classic experience without virtual reality (PC / Mac) with a desktop version.

Hyper realistic graphics

All the levels are generated by recording real locations in 360º, with the subtle integration of 3D elements, to transport you directly into the insane universe of DESOLATIUM.

8D/3D sound

This type of audio generates a surrounding sound effect that comes from many different directions at once, creating the feeling of being in a real life scenario where danger lurks in every corner... a few steps behind you... a chilling scream at your right...

Can you imagine hearing the piercing sounds of an Ancient God chasing you as you try to overcome obstacles on your way out? And to enjoy all this experience you only need your headphones.

Multiple endings

Will you be able to avoid more murders? Will you discover who is behind this?... Or maybe you will prefer to take part in a ritual?... The paths you follow and the decisions you make will mark your course... and your end.

Highly awarded

The DESOLATIUM project has been awarded and nominated on multiple occasions, being the following awards and nominations the most outstanding ones:

Music

We are honored to have XABI SAN MARTÍN in our team, composer and keyboardist in the band La Oreja de Van Gogh, who will be the composer of the DESOLATIUM soundtrack. He has been a huge video game lover from a very young age, both playing and participating in their development.

"Well, this… this game I think is one of the most absorbing and terrifying proposals that I’ve found lately, and I am quite up to date with the [videogame] sector. And the truth is that it is a real challenge trying to find an ambiance that fits the visual universe, you know? of this gem.

Of course, we have terrifying images and a wonderfully written and absorbing story, and so I think that in order to match that I am going to rescue the oldest, dustiest, rustiest synthesizers that I have, because I am going… I believe it is the time to start recording without any type of metronome or tuning… That is, I believe we need something rusty and horrible and suffocating to accompany the player in this “bad time” the game is proposing.

So like I said, I think this is the challenge, this is going to be the key to the ambiance of this game, and well… let’s hope we can rise to the challenge. I also have some experience with other games, but this one seems particularly challenging. So, well, I hope everything goes well, that we can have the whole game in our hands soon, and that we can all enjoy it… with some Sintrom nearby, because when I played the demo I almost spit my heart out.

So, that’s it… It’s a pleasure to greet you all and see you very soon."

Reality / In-Game

Reality / In-Game

Reality / In-Game

Art

Art

 

 

Juan Cassinello

CEO & Code Developer

He often uses ghouls to do the hard work. He is the genius behind the technical part of Desolatium. With years of experience on his shoulders, he has managed to perfect the art of the whip to "help motivate" his subordinates.

José María Coca

Game Designer

His mind and thoughts are perfectly compartmentalized. He is able to organize rituals blindfolded and nothing escapes his control, not even the elusive byakhee. Randolph Carter claims to be a friend of him.

Carlos Hermogenes Lax

Chief Creative Designer & Producer

His head is always in the clouds, or rather on the Leng plateau. One out of every five words he says is made up, although he claims that it is “Aklo”, whatever that is. He is convinced he had the Silver Key at some point, although he does not remember where he left it.

María Inmaculada Parra

Creative Designer & Producer

She masters several languages (she also ensures that “Aklo” is a language) and her mind works a different speed to the rest of us. If you want a good ritual, let her know. You will have sacrifices like you have never seen before.

Isabel Gálvez

Designer & Code Developer

Her hands can’t stay still; neither does her imagination. Her thing is to create and even the deep ones were surprised to see how accurately she had portrayed them. We think that she is being chased by a Hound of Tindalos, but it may also be another of her creations.

David Pérez

Screenwriter

Words are his entire world, but ever since he read that leather-bound book, his words are source of nightmares. She has started to draw a summoning circle in the office, she says that when it is finished he will be able to bring the script from Carcosa.

Irene Martínez

Social media

Tireless and brilliant. She got that job for Nyarlathotep and since then her cultists are legion. She runs every social media from her spell book, even though she has a company computer. "I like to work by hand," she whispers, so as not to disturb the spirits.

Game OST

Xabi San Martín, following in the footsteps of Erich Zann, has composed a soundtrack that will stir your guts, reach the depths of your soul and make you go crazy. The perfect music for your rituals and sacrifices.

Get the soundtrack composed by the famous musician and composer.

Artbook

Richard Upton Pickman will capture all his art and madness in a grimoire of about 50 pages, that you will be able to download and madly enjoy from home or wherever you like.

Download the game's art book, with sketches, illustrations and notes of the universe where it takes place.

Concept. The final art could be different

Poster

An exclusive poster for our benefactors, directly drawn from the dreams of Charles Dexter Ward.

Concept. The final art could be different

TShirt

Dress like a true sectarian, wearing maddening designs knitted with fibers brought from R'lyeh and impregnated with the blood of the ancients.

An exclusive shirt for our backers, with an original design.

Concept. The final art could be different

Physical Edition

Carved from Leng Plains mined stone and wrapped in human skin (or plastic, it depends on stock), you will receive a copy of the game at your door.

Receive a physical copy of the game for PS4, XBOX ONE, PC/MAC or SWITCH, with an exclusive cover for backers.

Concept. The final art could be different

Short campaign based on 100 system

Play an epic pencil and paper RPG adventure, written and designed by Count Fenalik, based on the universe of Desolatium.

Receive a book with various adventures that you will be able to play separately or as a campaign using the d100 system.

Concept. The final art could be different

* Shipping Rates for each add on: 

  • Europe: 10€
  • International: 14€

"Well, this… this game I think is one of the most absorbing and terrifying proposals that I’ve found lately, and I am quite up to date with the [videogame] sector. And the truth is that it is a real challenge trying to find an ambiance that fits the visual universe, you know? of this gem.
Of course, we have terrifying images and a wonderfully written and absorbing story, and so I think that in order to match that I am going to rescue the oldest, dustiest, rustiest synthesizers that I have, because I am going… I believe it is the time to start recording without any type of metronome or tuning… That is, I believe we need something rusty and horrible and suffocating to accompany the player in this “bad time” the game is proposing.
So like I said, I think this is the challenge, this is going to be the key to the ambiance of this game, and well… let’s hope we can rise to the challenge. I also have some experience with other games, but this one seems particularly challenging. So, well, I hope everything goes well, that we can have the whole game in our hands soon, and that we can all enjoy it… with some Sintrom nearby, because when I played the demo I almost spit my heart out.
So, that’s it… It’s a pleasure to greet you all and see you very soon."

 Reality / In-Game Reality / In-Game Reality / In-Game Art Art

 
 
Juan Cassinello
CEO & Code Developer
He often uses ghouls to do the hard work. He is the genius behind the technical part of Desolatium. With years of experience on his shoulders, he has managed to perfect the art of the whip to "help motivate" his subordinates.
José María Coca
Game Designer
His mind and thoughts are perfectly compartmentalized. He is able to organize rituals blindfolded and nothing escapes his control, not even the elusive byakhee. Randolph Carter claims to be a friend of him.
Carlos Hermogenes Lax
Chief Creative Designer & Producer
His head is always in the clouds, or rather on the Leng plateau. One out of every five words he says is made up, although he claims that it is “Aklo”, whatever that is. He is convinced he had the Silver Key at some point, although he does not remember where he left it.
María Inmaculada Parra
Creative Designer & Producer
She masters several languages (she also ensures that “Aklo” is a language) and her mind works a different speed to the rest of us. If you want a good ritual, let her know. You will have sacrifices like you have never seen before.
Isabel Gálvez
Designer & Code Developer
Her hands can’t stay still; neither does her imagination. Her thing is to create and even the deep ones were surprised to see how accurately she had portrayed them. We think that she is being chased by a Hound of Tindalos, but it may also be another of her creations.
David Pérez
Screenwriter
Words are his entire world, but ever since he read that leather-bound book, his words are source of nightmares. She has started to draw a summoning circle in the office, she says that when it is finished he will be able to bring the script from Carcosa.
Irene Martínez
Social media
Tireless and brilliant. She got that job for Nyarlathotep and since then her cultists are legion. She runs every social media from her spell book, even though she has a company computer. "I like to work by hand," she whispers, so as not to disturb the spirits. 

  

Game OST
Xabi San Martín, following in the footsteps of Erich Zann, has composed a soundtrack that will stir your guts, reach the depths of your soul and make you go crazy. The perfect music for your rituals and sacrifices.
Get the soundtrack composed by the famous musician and composer.
 Artbook
Richard Upton Pickman will capture all his art and madness in a grimoire of about 50 pages, that you will be able to download and madly enjoy from home or wherever you like.
Download the game's art book, with sketches, illustrations and notes of the universe where it takes place. Concept. The final art could be different
Poster
An exclusive poster for our benefactors, directly drawn from the dreams of Charles Dexter Ward. Concept. The final art could be different
TShirt
Dress like a true sectarian, wearing maddening designs knitted with fibers brought from R'lyeh and impregnated with the blood of the ancients.
An exclusive shirt for our backers, with an original design. Concept. The final art could be different
Physical Edition
Carved from Leng Plains mined stone and wrapped in human skin (or plastic, it depends on stock), you will receive a copy of the game at your door.
Receive a physical copy of the game for PS4, XBOX ONE, PC/MAC or SWITCH, with an exclusive cover for backers. Concept. The final art could be different
Short campaign based on 100 system
Play an epic pencil and paper RPG adventure, written and designed by Count Fenalik, based on the universe of Desolatium.
Receive a book with various adventures that you will be able to play separately or as a campaign using the d100 system. Concept. The final art could be different  * Shipping Rates for each add on: 

Europe: 10€
International: 14€

story:
WARNINGS: Swearing, blood, death, psychological, and a little gore.
Rating: 16+

In 20XX, an enormous earthquake shook the world and caused a triangular crater to suddenly appear in the middle of Bermuda Triangle. The world was aghast with this discovery; even more so when scout teams discovered an ‘invisible wall’ around it, preventing further investigation. As if it wasn’t enough, spiritual events also increased all over the world after this phenomenon occurred.

Our heroine, Maya (19), was a young adult who was busy earning her living so this kind of event was of little importance aside from adding an exciting spice into her life. But then her world crumbled when a Goddess came and announced that her family would die in a car accident in the near future.

The Goddess offered Maya a deal: She would alter her family’s fate in exchange for closing the Bermuda Crater. To do that, Maya would have to go to a place called Forgotten Isles, find what caused it, and look for a solution.

If she agreed, three men will accompany her, acting as bodyguards. Apparently, they each have their own circumstances and a wish to be granted.

Pledge with Paypal!

You want to pledge, but don't have a credit card? No problem! Backers can now pledge via Paypal.  To be fair, the limited edition pledges; "Early Birds" and "One for me & One for my buddy" will have the same number of limited items. So, for example; "Early Birds" pledge: 50 will be available for paypal & 50 will be available for credit cards (100 items in total). However, the "In Game Cameo" pledge will only have 1 available spot for paypal due to the original available spot is an odd number; 3.


Pledged via Paypal: $349
---------------------------~(O.O)~-----------------------------

...and many more!


  • World Map interaction; The events will be separated into Main story events and Character events. Character events will be indicated by their silhouette when you hover over the buttons so check carefully.

  • Casual Status Raising; the status you raise will help determine which bachelor route you're going to be in. After a certain amount of time, the system will choose the bachelor with the highest affection points along with the highest status points so keep track of them.

  • Regular Choices & Timed Choices; Don't forget to save! 

  • Translation & Definition Notes; As you play, you will notice that some words will be of different color. Click it to find its meaning/translation.
  • Blinking Sprites + Other minor animations; rain animation, fallen leaves, water ripples... well, I think you'll know once you try the demo and see Kahlil's sprite later x'D *no spoiler*
  • Layered clothes sprites that can be stripped if you managed to pick the right choices in certain circumstances (jacket to shirt to topless. Well you know the order :'D)
  • 1 Constant Minigame; Curious about the minigame? You can find out what it is and even try it at the end of the demo!
  • 4 Love interests (3 Protagonist + 1 Antagonist). Yep, you can date the evil guy after you finished the other 3 routes. That is, if you still want to after you uncover the truth *grin*.
  • Mini Encyclopedia; It will display Indonesian culture facts that appears in the game.
  • Re-nameable Heroine.
  • 9 Endings.
  • Original BGMs from talented composers.
  • 25+ Original CGs & 25+ BGs.



     

My plan is to develop Nusantara: Bermuda Triangle in a timeframe of 1 year. At the latest, it will be finished around early winter, 2018. Nevertheless, I will update every Monday. I've been doing this consistently for more than 2 years with my 1st & 2nd project at lemmasoft forum & facebook fanpage, so you will know exactly what I'm doing every week.

A lot of time will be invested in writing & editing. Bermuda will be a lot longer than my 1st project; Nusantara: Legend of the Winged Ones. For reference, the total of Bermuda's demo word count is 48k+ words while Winged Ones' demo is only around 19.5k+ words. 

I am determined to finish this project no matter what so I set the funding type to be Flexible. However much I gain will be used for my project's development, pay the composers, pay the bills, and feed my 2 pups -granted, it will be slower and simpler since I need to do side-jobs. It has been my dream to be able to work at home surrounded by the things I love, so this is a big step for me. 

Other expenses will be through my own pocket and further strengthened later by that 5% from funding plan.

IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT GAME DISTRIBUTION:

The finished game will be published in itch.io. Backers who have pledged for "Early Birds", "The Game <3", and "One for me & One for my buddy!" will be given itch.io Download Keys. Simply make an itch.io account, click the Download Key's link, and claim ownership to prevent anyone else from using it. After claiming ownership, you will be directed to the download page for Mac/Windows/Linux.

I will set the system so One key is for the use of One person only. 
 

What about Steam?

I am willing to try Steam Greenlight if the first goal is reached & a lot of you want it on Steam. If the Greenlight succeeded, I will distribute Steam Keys instead of itch.io's Download Keys.

Edit*: you can still request me for itch.io Download Keys if you don't want Steam keys.

  • US$4100 
    My original plan is to have 2 poses for each bachelors (1 main, 1 other. See Guntur's main gesture & his other gesture in demo). But if this stretch goal is reached, every bachelor will have 2 other gesture aside from the main gesture + 1 fighting pose; totalling 4 poses for each bachelor. Psst, I will also add more chibi animations & 2 additional costumes for the heroine & bachelors when they arrived at specific locations in game (Traditional Indonesia Batik & Winter clothes).


  • US$5500 
    Do you want more CGs? More backgrounds? If this stretch goal is reached, I will make more CGs, backgrounds, and illustrations for you to enjoy in game! I will push it to the maximum amount I can do to increase the story's immersion level.

  • US$6800 
    4 love interest is not enough? No worries! Reach this stretch goal and you'll get to romance Gale; a-dark-elf-look-alike who is a man of few words. His story will complement the Antagonist's story and only available once you finished the first 3 routes. So his route will start alongside the Antagonist's route.

  • Surpluses will be used for future game development. 

Hi! This is SweetChiel who is responsible for the fantasy adventure visual novel with winged guys in loin cloths*cough* -I mean, traditional Indonesia Batik clothes. Remember this baby of mine?

The warm welcome I received for Nusantara: Legend of the Winged Ones pushed me to make more visual novels with Indonesian elements in it. Please take note that Nusantara: Bermuda Triangle is NOT a sequel of Nusantara: Legend of the Winged Ones. It is set in the same world, but it will be in a wider horizon and a brand new story.

I really didn't expect myself to jump head first into becoming a visual novel developer since I didn't know a thing about programming 3 years ago, but who knew! After a trial of errors and tears, I feel that Ren'Py now is like a magic item which allows me to create a whole new world!

I also gained help from my friends & talented composers to make original BGMs; to 'breathe life' into Bermuda (click on their names to see their websites):

  • Bellpickle Troops
    This is a circle of my college friends and I who gathered to sell fanarts/anime merchandise at cons. They will help me with marketing & publishing the project! We have been together for quite a while now <3
     
  • KrystalFlare, Crystal Liu, &  Blasé&Voracious
    My beloved proofreaders who have been very supportive & patient with me! Unfortunately, Blasé&Voracious is no longer with us due to being busy.
     
  • Roland Melvin Z.
    The composer who has been with me from the moment Winged Ones was born! His skills to implement subtle Indonesian tones/instrument into the background music is awesome! He mainly contributes Forest themed original BGMs.
     
  • ErdaEnos
    Another talented composer who contributed to Reksa's original fighting BGMs and a few more! Sadly, she is no longer available due to her office work.
     
  • Alcaknight
    A talented composer who I stumbled upon in lemmasoft forum. Her taste is on point with mine and so far, her original fantasy musics has been dominating Bermuda.
     
  • Sinakhai
    Another composer I found in lemmasoft forum. Her original musics are dramatic, depressing in a good way, and carries a heavy amount of feelings! 
     
  • Albert Fernandez 
    Where I usually looked for good composers, this composer is the one who found me at my facebook fanpage and saved my day when I was in need of a complicated BGM! He has a wide understanding of music themes and never fails to impress me.
     
  • Other websites/composers who is providing royalty free BGms (Kevin Macleod, Soundimage.org, incompetech.com)

Yes, I know what you're thinking about; "Why so many composers!?" :'D  Well, I'm quite picky about BGMs and if it doesn't get the 'feeling' I'm looking for, I will tell him/her to edit it as many times as it needed. Since making original musics will take a lot of time, I decided to look for composers who has piled original musics of their own and if I like it, I will get in contact with them and discuss the usage price right away. If it's free to use/CC BY, I will donate after I have the funds. The amount of donation will depend on how many music I use from every composer.

One of the motivating factors that pushed me until now is your opinions/critiques so please, type away! Anything you want to convey, I will receive it with open arms! Feel free to be blunt too since I am eager to learn and improve in any way I can. I always love it when people tell me their thoughts or anything related to my 'babies' :') My heart can be pretty masochist about it too *cough*

If you feel like helping me on a monthly basis, I have a Patreon that basically funds my VNs and other art endeavours. If you pledge $5+ a month, you'll get to see more sneak peeks. Other variations includes behind the scenes scenarios, commission me, early access to game demos, and background step by step tutorial.

Lastly, help me share the words!
If you know someone who loves to read VNs with fantasy elements in it, let them know about Nusantara: Bermuda Triangle! Feel free to try the demo or get to know my writing style/story-telling style first by playing Nusantara: Legend of the Winged Ones; it's free to play!

Now I'm sure you're tired from reading all this information x'D
Thanks a lot for visiting, for being patient, and checking my project!

 

Risk & Challenges

You know, things happen in a game's production and there's life for me to live. But I will always let you know the progress I made & everything that happens every Monday so you will be there with me step by step. My motto is "Little by little will become a mountain." for me it means: "Commit yourself to progress every week and it will be finished before you know it!" 

Also, don't worry about me having too many things on my plate. The reason I solo the art, script, and programming is so I can keep track of them myself and it's faster to polish the game this way. I mean, if I want to change/re-new something, I can quickly finish it in one day than having to pass it to someone else and the file will be passed back and forth for awhile until it become how it should be. Better than having to chase after someone who missed the deadline like a demon, yeah? x'D 

The downside of this method is I will need more time compared to other projects.

story:
The Shadow Government Simulator is a PC puzzle/strategy game that puts you in control of a shadow organization dead set on global domination via bribery, intimidation, seduction, and any means necessary. Inspired by old classics like Plague Inc. and modern gems like The Shrouded Isle, this is a challenging game where you infiltrate nations, discover their networks of power, and then reshape them to fit your agenda

Sneak into nations around the world!​

 

 

Turn-based strategic infiltration.

In this game every action you take matters on a global scale. When you enter a new nation, you’ll be alone with just a headquarters at your disposal and minimal information. Slowly, you will send your tendrils throughout the region uncovering who are the influential and how much power they truly wield. You'll discover their traits and personalities, earning an understanding of their weaknesses and how to best convert them to your side.

Reshape society's network!

More importantly, you'll discover who they are connected to, and thus person by person, you shall take over the whole elite. Having a strong interconnected network is the key to success, but the bigger you get the more visible you are and this could lead to your demise. Manage your network, cutting and creating connections, to ensure you act from the shadows when the time is right.

​

Customize your unit's abilities to match your grand plan!

Evolve your organization

The world will be difficult to conquer without growth and adaptation. As you capture new units, you can change their abilities, unlocking new traits and adapting to the necessities of the shadow war. Throughout your campaign for world domination, you'll be able to build your organization with unique traits. Tailor your society and its pawns to fit your grand plan. Conquer the world and you'll be able to unlock different factions such as the Masons and the Templars, with different strengths and weaknesses!

Convert the elite to your cause

Fight for global supremacy

As your organization grows and becomes more visible on the global scale the challenges you face will increase. The world’s countries will unite against you and you will face off against rival organizations. Choose wisely which region to infiltrate first, as they will provide different bonuses, but also present different challenges. Each region will offer a distinct play experience with its procedurally generated networks. As time moves forward the regions will acquire unique modifiers to increase the difficulty and diversity of the maps you play on. It might well be worth the risk, however, as nations you take over become yours to command, unlocking new powerful abilities. Be it a person or a country, they shall all become like pawns before you!

​

Outwit rival secret societies!

Why Crowdfunding

I've been working as a game designer for over a decade, working on all sorts of games of different shapes and sizes, but always for someone else (a boss, a client, an investor). I was itching to create a game I could call my own, and after a long time of chipping away at weird experiments during afternoons and weekends, I found a concept that had tons of potential: Being a secret society.

Starting small, it grew step by step; from a board game version, to a digital prototype to a demo I could test with others.

Early Concept art.... lots of pretty ideas here that ended up making the game confusing :P

 

An early digital prototype of the game

For a few months, it lived as a prototype, continuously being worked on and shown at local Vancouver game events. It grew slowly from there, as the constant community playtesting and feedback proved invaluable to refine the gameplay.

Eventually it evolved to a point of polish where I realized this could be an actual, complete game! I'm really happy with the way the game is shaping up, but the final vision for it is much grander! I made a crowdfunding campaign to help raise funding to support the final stretch of development. The game has come a long way to the playable state it is currently in, but its only a fraction of what I hope to include in the final product.  Now, with the extra funding from the community, I am able to finish the remaining features, improve the art quality and release the full game on Steam.

The second reason for the campaign is to be judged by the community. You, the players, know what you want, and although I've worked really hard to prepare the game, I know there's much more to be done. I want your feedback, I want your insight, but most of all, I want to know if this is a concept you're interested in. The feedback on new features that are being planned will keep me on the right path and, with the help of the community, we'll create the amazing game that we have always dreamed of playing.

 

The funding of our campaign and any pledges here will be used to improve the game in many ways. I want to polish up the art and music, to make the game more intuitive and increase the overall polish of the final game. I also want to expand the reach of the game and localize it into many other languages (let me know which ones you want in the comments!).

I also want to use the funding to develop a better AI for the game that presents more of a challenge for players. Finally there are a few features I really want to implement but need extra funding to do so. These include more in-game scenarios, achievements, a tech tree for your secret society and more!

 

​

 

The shadow war is not limited to the game; it lives on in our Discord Server! When you join you get to sign up with a faction and compete on bi-weekly challenges to get the show the rest whose best! 

Example of a Venice-themed challenge won by the Illuminati!

I firmly believe games are better when there's a community to shape it. Join us by clicking any of these links!

 

Risks & Challenges

Making games is a commitment; they take a lot of work and expertise in different areas (programming, art, game design, etc...) to get right. I will be the first to acknowledge that there's a lot of things that can go wrong (technical issues, balance, dealing with platforms, etc...) and these can push back a project. My 10 years experience making games has shown me this again and again. But through those years I've gained a lot of experience to help me push through the obstacles in my path and to get help from other industry professionals for those that I can't handle alone. What I can promise you is that I'll keep the communication channels open and that you and the community will be the first to know what the game state is. I'll send regular updates and answer as many questions as I can to make sure that we got transparency above all. I'll do my darndest to get this game out in time and quality for all of you enjoy, and I'll make sure you are aware of every step of the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now but still want to support the project don't worry; your voice is just as needed. Help us spread the word! You can't have a secret society without a acolytes ;) If you are part of any gaming forums or servers, share them out link! Every bit helps!

THANK YOU!

Congrats on getting to the bottom of the page! Thank you for your time and consideration. I hope we can make an awesome game together.
story_txt:
The Shadow Government Simulator is a PC puzzle/strategy game that puts you in control of a shadow organization dead set on global domination via bribery, intimidation, seduction, and any means necessary. Inspired by old classics like Plague Inc. and modern gems like The Shrouded Isle, this is a challenging game where you infiltrate nations, discover their networks of power, and then reshape them to fit your agenda


Sneak into nations around the world!​
 
 
Turn-based strategic infiltration.
In this game every action you take matters on a global scale. When you enter a new nation, you’ll be alone with just a headquarters at your disposal and minimal information. Slowly, you will send your tendrils throughout the region uncovering who are the influential and how much power they truly wield. You'll discover their traits and personalities, earning an understanding of their weaknesses and how to best convert them to your side.

Reshape society's network!
More importantly, you'll discover who they are connected to, and thus person by person, you shall take over the whole elite. Having a strong interconnected network is the key to success, but the bigger you get the more visible you are and this could lead to your demise. Manage your network, cutting and creating connections, to ensure you act from the shadows when the time is right.
​

Customize your unit's abilities to match your grand plan!
Evolve your organization
The world will be difficult to conquer without growth and adaptation. As you capture new units, you can change their abilities, unlocking new traits and adapting to the necessities of the shadow war. Throughout your campaign for world domination, you'll be able to build your organization with unique traits. Tailor your society and its pawns to fit your grand plan. Conquer the world and you'll be able to unlock different factions such as the Masons and the Templars, with different strengths and weaknesses!

Convert the elite to your cause
Fight for global supremacy
As your organization grows and becomes more visible on the global scale the challenges you face will increase. The world’s countries will unite against you and you will face off against rival organizations. Choose wisely which region to infiltrate first, as they will provide different bonuses, but also present different challenges. Each region will offer a distinct play experience with its procedurally generated networks. As time moves forward the regions will acquire unique modifiers to increase the difficulty and diversity of the maps you play on. It might well be worth the risk, however, as nations you take over become yours to command, unlocking new powerful abilities. Be it a person or a country, they shall all become like pawns before you!
​
Outwit rival secret societies!



Why Crowdfunding

I've been working as a game designer for over a decade, working on all sorts of games of different shapes and sizes, but always for someone else (a boss, a client, an investor). I was itching to create a game I could call my own, and after a long time of chipping away at weird experiments during afternoons and weekends, I found a concept that had tons of potential: Being a secret society.
Starting small, it grew step by step; from a board game version, to a digital prototype to a demo I could test with others.


Early Concept art.... lots of pretty ideas here that ended up making the game confusing :P
 

An early digital prototype of the game
For a few months, it lived as a prototype, continuously being worked on and shown at local Vancouver game events. It grew slowly from there, as the constant community playtesting and feedback proved invaluable to refine the gameplay.
Eventually it evolved to a point of polish where I realized this could be an actual, complete game! I'm really happy with the way the game is shaping up, but the final vision for it is much grander! I made a crowdfunding campaign to help raise funding to support the final stretch of development. The game has come a long way to the playable state it is currently in, but its only a fraction of what I hope to include in the final product.  Now, with the extra funding from the community, I am able to finish the remaining features, improve the art quality and release the full game on Steam.
The second reason for the campaign is to be judged by the community. You, the players, know what you want, and although I've worked really hard to prepare the game, I know there's much more to be done. I want your feedback, I want your insight, but most of all, I want to know if this is a concept you're interested in. The feedback on new features that are being planned will keep me on the right path and, with the help of the community, we'll create the amazing game that we have always dreamed of playing.

I want to polish up the art and music, to make the game more intuitive and increase the overall polish of the final game. I also want to expand the reach of the game and localize it into many other languages (let me know which ones you want in the comments!).
I also want to use the funding to develop a better AI for the game that presents more of a challenge for players. Finally there are a few features I really want to implement but need extra funding to do so. These include more in-game scenarios, achievements, a tech tree for your secret society and more!

Making games is a commitment; they take a lot of work and expertise in different areas (programming, art, game design, etc...) to get right. I will be the first to acknowledge that there's a lot of things that can go wrong (technical issues, balance, dealing with platforms, etc...) and these can push back a project. My 10 years experience making games has shown me this again and again. But through those years I've gained a lot of experience to help me push through the obstacles in my path and to get help from other industry professionals for those that I can't handle alone. What I can promise you is that I'll keep the communication channels open and that you and the community will be the first to know what the game state is. story:
Overview

Revn is a third person shooter + MOBA hybrid game. Two teams of 5 players battle it out with the help of minions. Explore different abilities and strategies to crown your team victorious. Revn has no set classes or heroes, and allows you to choose from 25+ abilities to form your own personal loadout.

A New Kind of MOBA

Revn doesn't have traditional character classes or heroes to choose from. Instead, combine any abilities to create your own synergies.

We've combined the teamwork and evolving meta of a MOBA with the fast paced action of a third person shooter. Player customization, fun moment-to-moment gameplay, and competitive integrity are some of our core design pillars.

Revn already includes player profiles and stats, a robust replay system, an ELO-based skill rating system, bots, and an expanding API that we will be making public for third party developers.

Customize your arsenal

Players can modify their weapons with a wide range of attachments. We currently have 8 weapon classes, each with their own unique customization options.

Choose from over 30 abilities and 17+ items. Level them up during the match to overpower your enemies.

 

Construct your team's fortress

Deploy a drone and place walls, turrets, force fields, and more to defend your Nexus. A strong defense can mean the difference between victory and defeat in Revn.

 

Developer Blogs & Weekly Patches

Transparency is a core tenant of development at Project Ambitious Games. We post semi-monthly development blogs to our website, letting players know what we are working on. Our Discord server is always active and we love discussing games with players, and gathering feedback.

We also pride ourselves on releasing a patch every week. We've released over 80 patches for Revn to date. You can see the patch notes for every single update here.

What do we need funding for?

We want to build dedicated servers for Revn. Dedicated servers will improve the gameplay experience for all players. We plan to use a cloud based solution such as Amazon GameLift. 

The funds we raise in this campaign should allow us to run dedicated servers for several months. If we exceed our goal, the development team will be able to work more hours. We all work part-time on Revn, with other jobs taking up much of our time every week. With enough funding, we can work fewer hours at these day jobs, and focus on creating Revn.

About the team

Project Ambitious Games is an independent game development studio founded in 2016. We have 10 team members working on Revn, including industry veterans from companies like CD Projekt Red. For more about our team, click here.

Learn More

Join our Discord server. Its the best place to talk with us and ask your questions!

Check out the subreddit. We love seeing your feedback and discussions about the game.

Follow us on Twitter or Instagram. Your support means a lot to us :)

 

STRETCH GOALS

We're working as hard as possible on Revn. With additional funding, we can take time off from our day jobs and focus on creating Revn and adding more content!

 

Additional daily & mastery challenges

If we raise $7,000+ we will add new daily and mastery challenges. Players will be able to earn rewards by completing mini-objectives. Who doesn't love a challenge?

Required amount: $7,000 USD - NOT REACHED

Melee weapons

Currently, Revn only has guns! We would like to implement melee weapons, such as knives and swords. Help us reach this goal.

Required amount: $10,000 USD - NOT REACHED

story:
Kinder World is a mobile game of houseplants, healing and practicing kindness. ❤️

Take care of your plants and yourself in a relaxing and lush atmosphere of your own design, completing daily acts of self-love that make the world a kinder place.

Players nurture their plants in-game by nurturing themselves in the real world, completing evidence-based wellbeing exercises like stretching, breathing, and expressing gratitude.

Practice showing kindness to others by sharing supportive messages and plant cuttings with other players in Kinder World.  Collective player choices like these, and in-game events will influence the growth of a shared Community Tree over time.

We're developing Kinder World to address the Kindness Gap. The overwhelming majority of us want to be kinder to ourselves, but don't know where to start. Kinder World breaks down the concept of 'self-kindness' into something accessible by pairing houseplant care gameplay with evidence-based activities. We’re using our experience as game developers in collaboration with psychologists like Harvard-based Dr. Tara Cousineau, PhD, to create something evidence-backed, relaxing and accessible, helping us to be kind to ourselves and to others. 

 

In a world where kindness can be hard to come by, we believe that each and every one of us has the capacity for compassion.

It’s only by nurturing ourselves, like a houseplant, that we can make the world a better place for all of us.

With your support, we can work together to create a truly Kinder World. ❤️

 

Gameplay in Kinder World is designed for a slower pace, without pressure or competition. Players water or fertilize their plants by doing a calming daily exercise of their choice, which depends on the plant species they’re caring for. 

We have designed Kinder World with you and your wellbeing in mind. Some of our influences include games like Animal Crossing, Neko Atsume, Tabikaeru (旅かえる) and Tsuki Adventure.

Players can nurture three pillars of kindness in Kinder World:

☘️ Yourself: Being kind to yourself

  • Nurture and grow a houseplant by practicing kind actions, such as a gratitude exercises
  • Every houseplant you grow will be uniquely yours through procedural generation
  • Customize and decorate your green space to create your ultimate personal relaxation zone

☘️ Community: Support each other in a kind community

  • Share your kindness journey with others, and support other players by sending community messages
  • Gift plant cuttings to friends and other players you meet in Kinder World

☘️ World: Being a part of a kinder world movement

  • Grow and nourish the Community Tree together
  • Have your say, and contribute to global charity events that make an impact in the real world

Have you seen Samy? Now you have! Samy is your friendly neighborhood guide in Kinder World, dropping by occasionally to keep you company and encourage you. Samy can also join your room for players who back the Cozy Pet Pack perk or higher - the perfect companion while you raise your plants!

 

Practicing kindness should be a fun thing to do. The Kinder World vision is for players to grow and create their own personal lush paradise—the ultimate oasis of relaxation in your pocket. 

We want you to design your own world, and truly make it your own. Your support as a backer helps us work with artists and creators to create even more in-game items, like growable plants, pots and decorations.

We’re excited to offer Unique Treat Pack backers completely one-of-a-kind plant pot designs that only they will have, and Luxury Pack  backers will receive a physical art print of one of their own houseplants, and have their favorite plant added as an in-game decoration for players to collect. Several of our reward perks also include special in-game items, such as plant pot designs from artists including Komomorebi, Maobaby, Rainylune, Cindy Xia, Bei Badgirl, Mayticks, Snowlattes, Morgan Meehan-Lam, Jisoupy and Meggy Vodušek!

 

There are three ingredients that make Kinder World special:

☘️  1. Learn and practice self-kindness in a fun and mindful way

Our vision for Kinder World comes from a lot of research and soul-searching.

We’ve interviewed hundreds of folks, and an overwhelming 95% of us want to be kinder to ourselves. The problem is we don’t know where to start, or many of us have tried and failed with more ‘traditional’ tools. To address this gap, we’re using our experience as game developers to create something evidence-backed, relaxing and accessible, that helps us to be kind to ourselves and to others. Kinder World breaks down the concept of self-kindness into something accessible by pairing houseplant care gameplay with evidence-based activities, like gratitude exercises.

 

 

☘️  2. Be surrounded by a kindness culture

Our unique approach with Kinder World brings community and interactivity together, through shared goals and values.

Humans are social creatures. Through our previous work on the body acceptance game Body Posi, we validated that self-kindness is far more effective in a community setting. This makes our approach different to existing tools, which are generally solitary and disconnected experiences.

☘️ 3. Enjoy building and caring for your personal plant paradise

And why the houseplant theme, you ask? We’re inspired by our personal experiences with them! Houseplants are the perfect way to slow down, to have a daily mindful moment, and to treat ourselves kindly. Real or digital, houseplants help people - so it’s no surprise that 2020 was the biggest year for houseplants yet! 

 

 

We have partnered with kindness expert and Clinical Psychologist Dr Tara Cousineau (Ph.D) to ensure that our approach develops kindness for the self and others in measurable ways. The game design of Kinder World follows the PEPPIE framework (Presence, Emotion regulation, Perspective, Purpose, Integration and Effort) and other leading research to help players develop these skills. For further reading, we recommend Dr Cousineau's book The Kindness Cure.

While playing Kinder World isn’t a replacement for therapy, our gameplay is designed as a good concrete practice alongside professional support. You can also tailor your in-game experience for where you’re at personally. In the future, we plan to add content and activities focused on stretching, relaxation skills, confidence, and more.

 

The Community Tree is an in-game representation of the Kinder World community. As seasons change and events take place, the tree itself will change. Through supporting our Indiegogo campaign with the Kind Heart Pack or higher, you can contribute to messages that all players will see on the tree, and you can help us select charities that in-game Community Tree events will support.

 

Backing Kinder World shows that you long for greater compassion for yourself and for others, just like we do.

You’ll become the backbone of a unique kindness-focused community. Help us define what kindness means to you, and discover ways to bring kindness to the world through the game. By backing us you will directly inform our development and contribute to building a houseplant world that thrives on kindness. Our priority with this campaign is to connect with special people who care, like you. We can’t wait to meet you!

If you are able to support our campaign now, Kinder World will also be able to grow to include rare plants, more customization items and new ways to be kind to each other. We will also be able to build more kindness learning resources and offer different in-game activities for players to enjoy together.

Houseplant Care Cards preview!

We're excited to share previews of the Houseplant Care Cards, a physical deck of mini cards including tips for raising your real life plant friends! These cards are available at the Plant Lover Pack perk and above. These designs aren't final, but we're excited to bring our past experience in designing card decks into Kinder World!

 

Special Artist Pots add-ons!

You can add special pots from our collab artists to your pledge! Take a look at a sample of pots from our collab artists, including pots by Maobaby, Cindy Xia, Mayticks, Morgan Meehan-Lam and Meggy Vodušek!

 

Exclusive Backers-only Pot and Plant designs!

Maobaby is the collaboration artist behind our adorable exclusive Flower Kitty Backer's Pot, and Meggy Vodušek created the gorgeous (and growable!) Dragon Tail Backer's Plant!

Backers at the Basic Pack or higher will receive the exclusive pot, and backers at the Mother Nature perk or higher will also get the exclusive Dragon Tail plant in their game!

 

To test our vision for Kinder World, we’ve already created a community that practices kindness together on Discord.

We love the Kinder World community. Mimicking the eventual in-game community experience, our Discord members share daily messages of gratitude, kind words for one another, as well as sharing amazing ‘real life’ houseplant and pet pictures. 

We would love for you to join us. Being a part of the Kinder World community is a wonderful part of the game experience as well - with sneak peaks at the game’s development, special events outside of the game, and more. Already the community has shared hundreds of gratitude moments, and over two hundred kind wishes that are used in the game itself.

 

To experience what it’s like, you can join the Kinder World Discord now! ❤️ Backers also get access to a special Backers Only channel for early sneak peeks at upcoming content!

 

You can read more about Kinder World and the team in Gamespot, Pocket Gamer, Well Played, CBR.com, 25 Years Later, 148 Apps, Behind Gaming and more!

 

Our all-female team is very diverse - we have migrant backgrounds, lived experiences as people of color, members of the LGBTQIA+ community, and multilingual team members. We’re fun, smart, communicative and ambitious. 

 

 

Lauren Clinnick

Lauren is the CEO, with a focus on Business Development, Marketing and Community Management. A lot of her time is spent with players, getting feedback and input on Kinder World, as well as trying to reach those who love the vision of the game as much as we do. She has previously worked in encryption, consumables marketing, and in the tech startup space. She has qualifications in Business and Arts, and her favorite houseplant is Monstera!

Christina Chen

Christina is the CTO on the team, and does technical work on the game - including coding, deployment (getting it out to players!) and technical production. As well as her experience as a game developer, publisher and analyst, Christina has previously worked in supercomputing at Microsoft, as a Senior Producer at PopCap, and even worked on the payment system behind XBox Live. She has qualifications in Software Engineering, Electrical and Systems Engineering, Psychology and Data Science. Her favorite houseplant is Dragontail!

Mandy Bo

Mandy is the Designer and Artist on the team. It’s her beautiful art that you see in-game, and the player experience is shaped by her design. She’s experienced as both a digital and traditional artist, and trained as a game designer. She’s a big fan of plants and magic, and her favorite houseplant is Devil’s Ivy!

We also have the pleasure of working with:

James Lewis - Film and Video Editor

Tamara Partridge - Audio Design

 

 

Kinder World needs you. ❤️ Please back our campaign to support our vision and journey - we can’t wait to meet you, and get your help in creating a relaxing game world for healing, houseplants and practicing kindness.

How to help:

1) Back our campaign - choose the perk that excites you! Or pledge any amount - everything helps support our small team.

2) Share the Kinder World InDemand page with your social channels - this is the best way for new folks to find us! Here's an announcement tweet to share!

3) Stay connected! You can also find us on Twitter and Instagram.

4) Join the Kinder World Community Discord

5)  Play the demo and share it with friends! (iOS 13+ or Android 10+ required)
